title: How to Draw a Silhouette

steps.headline: Draw big oval.
steps.description: Put a rectangle at the bottom, just barely overlapping the lower edge as seen.

steps.headline: Add two smaller ovals.
steps.description: Add two lines to indicate the shape of the face. At this point it should almost like a stick figure boxing, or reaching up to high-five another stick figure.

steps.headline: Draw a semicircle on one side of the big oval and add a triangle at the bottom.
steps.description: The arc will be the back of the head and the triangle is the curve of the neck.

steps.headline: Detail the chin, lips, and nose.
steps.description: Connect the shapes to one another, so the silhouette starts looking more like a face and less like a work of abstract art.

steps.headline: Erase all extraneous lines within the image.
steps.description: Draw the shadow of the hair by adding a few tufts near the top and the back.

steps.headline: Outline the image using black ink (or crayon if you want).
steps.description: Fill the entire thing in with black color to finish up the silhouette.

text: Draw big oval. Put a rectangle at the bottom, just barely overlapping the lower edge as seen. Add two smaller ovals. Add two lines to indicate the shape of the face. At this point it should almost like a stick figure boxing, or reaching up to high-five another stick figure. Draw a semicircle on one side of the big oval and add a triangle at the bottom. The arc will be the back of the head and the triangle is the curve of the neck. Detail the chin, lips, and nose. Connect the shapes to one another, so the silhouette starts looking more like a face and less like a work of abstract art. Erase all extraneous lines within the image. Draw the shadow of the hair by adding a few tufts near the top and the back. Outline the image using black ink (or crayon if you want). Fill the entire thing in with black color to finish up the silhouette.
